name: 劉傳銘
objective: In this course, we study the TCP/IP Internetworking, client-server paradigm, and socket API that application programs use for network communications. We first introduce the TCP/IP model and then discuss how the basic tools can be used to create servers, emphasizing practical designs and techniques that are important to programmers. Topics include OSI model, TCP/IP model, Client-Server Model and Software Design, Concurrent Processing in Client-Server Software, Socket API, Client Software Design, Server Software Design, TCP/UDP, Remote Procedure Calls, and new topics related to the Internet.
schedule:
1 Introduction and Overview (2hrs)
2 OSI Model (3hrs)
3 Client Server Model and Software Design (3hrs)
4 Concurrent Processing in Client-Server Software (2hr)
5 Socket API (5hrs)
6 Client Software Design and Example (6hrs)
7 Server Software Design and Example (15hrs)
8 Tunneling and Application Level Gatways (4hrs)
9 XDR and RPC (8hrs)
10 Presentations on Other Protocols (6hrs)
scorePolicy:
1.　　Quizzes　　         10%　　
2.　　Homework　　         50%　　
3.　　Presentations　　10%　　
4.　　Final Exam　　30%

•All the students in this class will be grouped into groups of 3. Each group needs to present an existing protocol about in the end of this semester and write a report to summarize the current status of that protocol. 
•Quiz will be given without notice.
